title: control 1
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA purity and integrity were evaluated by ND-1000 Spectrophotometer (NanoDrop, Wilmington, USA), Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Palo Alto, USA).
label_protocol_ch1: The miRNA Microarray System with miRNA Complete Labeling and hybridization Kit (Agilent Technologies) was used according to the manufacturer′s recommended protocol. The Agilent microRNA Spike-In Kit was used for in-process control to measure labeling and hybridization efficiency.  Briefly, 100ng total RNA was dephosphorylated at 37°C for 30 min with calf intestinal phosphatase and denatured by using 100% DMSO at 100°C for 7min. Samples were labeled with pCp-Cy3 using T4 ligase by incubation at 16°C for 2 hour. The labeled RNA samples were purified in a Vacuum Concentrator for one hour. Once samples are completely dried.
hyb_protocol: Each labeled Samples were prepared for hybridization by adding nuclease-free water, Hyb Spike-In solution, 10X GE Blocking Agent and 2X Hi-RPM Hybridization Buffer. 45μl of hybridization solution was dispensed into the gasket slide and assembled to the Agilent SurePrint G3 Human miRNA 8X60K, V19.0 Microarrays (Agilent®), and then rotated at 20 rpm for 20 h at 55°C.
scan_protocol: Agilent Gene Expression Wash Buffers 1(RT) and 2(37°C) were used after hybridization as recommended by Agilent miRNA Microarray System and were scanned on a Agilent Technologies G4900DA SureScan scanner using 3 μm resolution.
data_processing: Raw data were extracted using Agilent Feature Extraction software v11.0 (Agilent Technologies). The raw data for same miRNA was then summarized automatically in Agilent feature extraction protocol to generate Gene view file, providing expression data for each miRNA probed on the array. Array data were filtered by gIsGeneDetected =1 in all samples (1 : detected). Selected miRNA gTotalGeneSignal value was transformed by logarithm and normalized by quantile method.
data_processing.1: Please note that each set (i.e. set1 and set2) was analyzed independently.
contact_department: School of Dentistry, Microbiology and Immunology

title: control 2
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA purity and integrity were evaluated by ND-1000 Spectrophotometer (NanoDrop, Wilmington, USA), Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Palo Alto, USA).
label_protocol_ch1: The miRNA Microarray System with miRNA Complete Labeling and hybridization Kit (Agilent Technologies) was used according to the manufacturer′s recommended protocol. The Agilent microRNA Spike-In Kit was used for in-process control to measure labeling and hybridization efficiency.  Briefly, 50~60ng total RNA was dephosphorylated at 37°C for 30 min with calf intestinal phosphatase and denatured by using 100% DMSO at 100°C for 7min. Samples were labeled with pCp-Cy3 using T4 ligase by incubation at 16°C for 2 hour. The labeled RNA samples were purified in a Vacuum Concentrator for one hour. Once samples are completely dried.

scan_protocol: Agilent Gene Expression Wash Buffers 1(RT) and 2(37°C) were used after hybridization as recommended by Agilent miRNA Microarray System and were scanned on a Agilent Technologies G4900DA SureScan scanner using 3 μm resolution.
data_processing: Raw data were extracted using Agilent Feature Extraction software v11.0 (Agilent Technologies). The raw data for same miRNA was then summarized automatically in Agilent feature extraction protocol to generate Gene view file, providing expression data for each miRNA probed on the array. Array data were filtered by gIsGeneDetected =1 in all samples (1 : detected). Selected miRNA gTotalGeneSignal value was transformed by logarithm and normalized by quantile method.
data_processing.1: Please note that each set (i.e. set1 and set2) was analyzed independently.
